question: when did computer become widespread in homes and schools
vanilla_rag_result: Computer usage became widespread in schools by the early 1980s, with significant growth occurring throughout the 1980s and into the 1990s. By 1989, computers were present in nearly every school district in the United States. In homes, the widespread adoption of personal computers began in the 1980s as well, particularly with the introduction of the IBM PC and Apple computers. By the mid-1990s, computers had become common in both homes and schools, with increasing access to technology continuing into the 2000s.
